item.title: IntelliJ IDEA shortcut in linux
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description:
After a lot of digging around, I finally came across this blog entry telling how to make a shortcut to IDEA work in linux. In short, change your shortcut to something like the following:

/bin/sh -c "export JDK_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun && /opt/IntelliJIdea8/bin/idea.sh"

Voila! Victory is mine!

item.title: Linux seen through different Windows
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description: I’m a sucker for new features. I love to see new gadgets, widgets and UI updates but shy away from bells and whistles. After the shininess has dulled and the day-to-day functionality is what I’m left with, I tend to go with function & performance over form. For that, I tend to try a new window manager or desktop environment about every 6 months on my linux installations. I’ve just recently moved from LXDE to KDE (4.2) to Gnome (2.24.1).
